summary: This document is a chain of emails from January 2020 between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel regarding travel approval requests and logistical issues for trips related to the Epstein investigation (2018R01618). The emails detail frustrations over booking refundable international flights to Stockholm, Sweden, and reference prior domestic travel for victim interviews in Los Angeles and West Palm Beach.

events.title: Planned Travel to Stockholm for Interview
events.description: Planned international travel by SDNY personnel to Stockholm, Sweden, for an interview related to the Epstein investigation. The trip involves flights from JFK to Stockholm via Paris.

events.title: Interview Travel to Los Angeles
events.description: Prior travel by the SDNY team to Los Angeles for an interview (or interviews) related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Interview Travel to Los Angeles
events.description: Prior travel by the SDNY team to Los Angeles for an interview related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Interview Travel to West Palm Beach
events.description: Prior travel by SDNY personnel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for an interview related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Travel for Meetings in West Palm Beach
events.description: Prior travel by the SDNY team to West Palm Beach, Florida, for meetings and victim interviews related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Travel for Meetings in West Palm Beach
events.description: Prior travel by SDNY personnel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for meetings and interviews related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Travel for Meetings in Florida
events.description: Initial referenced travel by SDNY personnel to West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida, for meetings and interviews related to the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The emails are related to the Epstein investigation, case number 2018R01618, described as 'an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity'.
SDNY personnel were planning international travel to Stockholm, Sweden, in February 2020 for an interview, indicating the investigation's active, international scope.
The correspondence reveals logistical tensions and strict requirements for refundable international flight tickets for government travel related to the case.
The emails reference a pattern of prior domestic travel for victim interviews in Los Angeles and West Palm Beach throughout 2019.
Multiple email addresses and names are redacted, indicated by placeholders like 'M' and blanks, suggesting the document is partially censored.
